intro: Barleria rivae, commonly known as the river barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Barleria rivae is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
